Installation & Set-up¶

aenet package should be installed first. Follow the instructurion on GitHub aenet or aenet documentation. A Fortran compiler (e.g., gfortran or ifort ) and the Math Kernel Library (MKL) are necessary during the compiling of aenet package. The OpenMPI package is optional, which offers the parallel computing.

Prerequisites¶

  • aenet >= 2.0.3

  • python >=3.6

  • cython

  • numpy

Installation of MKL¶

On the homepage of Math Kernel Library (MKL), select the Stand-Alone Version or Toolkit. After the installation, system environment variables should be set by running

$ source /opt/intel/oneapi/setvars.sh intel64

Test the installation: echo $MKLROOT, which should return the installation path of mkl, e.g. /opt/intel/oneapi/mkl/2023.1.0.

Installation of aenet-python¶

Install the aenet-python package from the source directory:

$ pip install . --user

or

$ python setup.py install --user

ænet-python
